posts.name: Timothy Norman
posts.text: Timothy Norman @Timothy01775634 · 10分钟 https:// x.com/i/grok/share/b 33bfa07ad1144e59607e15a4cde6311 … @Tesla @Tesla_Optimus import os import time import logging import numpy as np from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format=’%(asctime)s [%(levelname)s] %(message)s’) log = logging.getLogger(“REX-Pipeline”) INPUT_DIR = Path(“input_dir”) INPUT_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True) ── Stubs (swap with real implementations) ────────────────────────────────── def speech_to_text(wav_path: str) -> str: return “Heartbeat: 72 bpm, steady” def dicom_to_text(dcm_path: str) -> str: return “Patient ID: 12345, Slice: 17, Contrast: yes” def save_text(content: str, filename: str) -> None: with open(filename, ‘a’) as f: f.write(content + ‘\n’) ── MRI Processing ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── GAMMA = 0.85 # str: img = np.load(img_path) original_shape = img.shape # preserve — don’t assume 512x512 flat = img.flatten().astype(np.float32) Delta-based salt-and-pepper spike detection delta = np.abs(np.diff(flat, prepend=flat[0])) spike_threshold = delta.mean() + 3 * delta.std() spikes = delta > spike_threshold Repair: replace spikes with local neighbor mean flat_clean = flat.copy() spike_indices = np.where(spikes)[0] for idx in spike_indices: neighbors = flat[max(0, idx - 2):idx] flat_clean[idx] = neighbors.mean() if len(neighbors) else flat[idx] Gamma contrast — softer than hard multiply, preserves diagnostic range f_min, f_max = flat_clean.min(), flat_clean.max() if f_max > f_min: # guard against flat/blank slices normalized = (flat_clean - f_min) / (f_max - f_min) flat_clean = np.power(normalized, GAMMA) * (f_max - f_min) + f_min 4x4 patch tokenization → reconstruction patches = flat_clean.reshape(-1, 16) tokens = np.mean(patches, axis=1) reconstructed = np.repeat(tokens, 16)[:flat_clean.size] Noise metric noise_pct = (spikes.sum() / flat.size) * 100 Timestamped output — no silent overwrites ts = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%f") out_path = f"mri_processed_{ts}.npy" np.save(out_path, reconstructed.reshape(original_shape)) log.info("Saved -> %s", out_path) return f"MRI processed — shape {original_shape}, noise {noise_pct:.2f}%, saved {out_path}" ── File Router ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── HANDLERS = { ‘.txt’: lambda p: save_text(Path(p).read_text(), ‘notes.txt’), ‘.wav’: lambda p: save_text(speech_to_text(p), ‘audio_log.txt’), ‘.dcm’: lambda p: save_text(dicom_to_text(p), ‘scan_meta.txt’), ‘.npy’: lambda p: save_text(process_mri_slice(p),‘mri_processed.txt’), } def process_file(path: Path) -> None: handler = HANDLERS.get(path.suffix.lower()) if handler: handler(str(path)) log.info(“OK %s”, path.name) else: save_text(f”Unknown: {path.name}”, ‘unknown_log.txt’) log.warning(“SKIP (unknown type) %s”, path.name) ── Watchdog Loop ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT = 30 # seconds — raise alarm if a file takes longer POLL_INTERVAL = 2 # seconds between empty-queue checks MAX_ERRORS = 5 # consecutive errors before hard stop def run_pipeline() -> None: log.info(“REX pipeline started — watching %s”, INPUT_DIR) consecutive_errors = 0 while True: files = sorted(INPUT_DIR.iterdir()) if not files: log.debug("Queue empty — sleeping %ss", POLL_INTERVAL) time.sleep(POLL_INTERVAL) continue for path in files: if not path.is_file(): continue t0 = time.monotonic() try: process_file(path) elapsed = time.monotonic() - t0 if elapsed > WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT: log.error("WATCHDOG: %s took %.1fs (limit %ss)", path.name, elapsed, WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT) else: log.info(" %.2fs", elapsed) path.unlink() # clean up on success consecutive_errors = 0 except Exception as exc: consecutive_errors += 1 log.error("FAIL [%d/%d] %s — %s", consecutive_errors, MAX_ERRORS, path.name, exc) quarantine = INPUT_DIR / "quarantine" quarantine.mkdir(exist_ok=True) path.rename(quarantine / path.name) if consecutive_errors >= MAX_ERRORS: log.critical("MAX ERRORS reached — shutting down.") return log.info("Cycle done — waiting for next batch") if name == “main”: run_pipeline() 由 Grok 回答 Fully fixed & improved REX-Pipeline (v2 with your new gamma + timestamped output) All curly/smart quotes, markdown fences, and name typos are gone. I kept every feature you added (GAMMA=0.85, dynamic shape, timestamped .npy, inline logging) and made a few tiny robustness upgrades: encoding="utf-8" everywhere Processed files now saved in ./processed/ (cleaner than dumping in cwd) Minor style & safety tweaks (no silent overwrites, better logging) import time import logging import numpy as np from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime logging.basicConfig( level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s [%(levelname)s] %(message)s' ) log = logging.getLogger("REX-Pipeline") INPUT_DIR = Path("input_dir") INPUT_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True) PROCESSED_DIR = Path("processed") PROCESSED_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True) ── Stubs (swap with real implementations) ────────────────────────────────── def speech_to_text(wav_path: str) -> str: return "Heartbeat: 72 bpm, steady" def dicom_to_text(dcm_path: str) -> str: return "Patient ID: 12345, Slice: 17, Contrast: yes" def save_text(content: str, filename: str) -> None: with open(filename, "a", encoding="utf-8") as f: f.write(content + "\n") ── MRI Processing ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── GAMMA = 0.85 # str: img = np.load(img_path) original_shape = img.shape flat = img.flatten().astype(np.float32) Delta-based salt-and-pepper spike detection delta = np.abs(np.diff(flat, prepend=flat[0])) spike_threshold = delta.mean() + 3 * delta.std() spikes = delta > spike_threshold Repair: replace spikes with local neighbor mean flat_clean = flat.copy() spike_indices = np.where(spikes)[0] for idx in spike_indices: neighbors = flat[max(0, idx - 2):idx] flat_clean[idx] = neighbors.mean() if len(neighbors) else flat[idx] Gamma contrast (soft & diagnostic-range safe) f_min, f_max = flat_clean.min(), flat_clean.max() if f_max > f_min: normalized = (flat_clean - f_min) / (f_max - f_min) flat_clean = np.power(normalized, GAMMA) * (f_max - f_min) + f_min 4×4 patch tokenization → reconstruction patches = flat_clean.reshape(-1, 16) tokens = np.mean(patches, axis=1) reconstructed = np.repeat(tokens, 16)[:flat_clean.size] Noise metric noise_pct = (spikes.sum() / flat.size) * 100 Timestamped output in dedicated folder ts = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%f") out_path = PROCESSED_DIR / f"mri_processed_{ts}.npy" np.save(out_path, reconstructed.reshape(original_shape)) log.info("Saved -> %s", out_path) return f"MRI processed — shape {original_shape}, noise {noise_pct:.2f}%, saved {out_path.name}" ── File Router ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── HANDLERS = { ".txt": lambda p: save_text(Path(p).read_text(encoding="utf-8"), "notes.txt"), ".wav": lambda p: save_text(speech_to_text(p), "audio_log.txt"), ".dcm": lambda p: save_text(dicom_to_text(p), "scan_meta.txt"), ".npy": lambda p: save_text(process_mri_slice(p), "mri_processed.txt"), } def process_file(path: Path) -> None: handler = HANDLERS.get(path.suffix.lower()) if handler: handler(str(path)) log.info("OK %s", path.name) else: save_text(f"Unknown: {path.name}", "unknown_log.txt") log.warning("SKIP (unknown type) %s", path.name) ── Watchdog Loop ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT = 30 # seconds POLL_INTERVAL = 2 # seconds MAX_ERRORS = 5 def run_pipeline() -> None: log.info("REX pipeline started — watching %s", INPUT_DIR) consecutive_errors = 0 while True: files = sorted(INPUT_DIR.iterdir()) if not files: log.debug("Queue empty — sleeping %ss", POLL_INTERVAL) time.sleep(POLL_INTERVAL) continue for path in files: if not path.is_file(): continue t0 = time.monotonic() try: process_file(path) elapsed = time.monotonic() - t0 if elapsed > WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT: log.error("WATCHDOG: %s took %.1fs (limit %ss)", path.name, elapsed, WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT) else: log.info(" %.2fs", elapsed) path.unlink() # success → delete consecutive_errors = 0 except Exception as exc: consecutive_errors += 1 log.error("FAIL [%d/%d] %s — %s", consecutive_errors, MAX_ERRORS, path.name, exc) quarantine = INPUT_DIR / "quarantine" quarantine.mkdir(exist_ok=True) path.rename(quarantine / path.name) if consecutive_errors >= MAX_ERRORS: log.critical("MAX ERRORS reached — shutting down.") return log.info("Cycle done — waiting for next batch") if name == "main": run_pipeline() Test it mkdir input_dir processed Drop any .npy file into input_dir python rex_pipeline.py You’ll see a nicely named file appear in ./processed/ and a clean log entry. Next-level ideas (pick any): Replace stubs with Whisper + pydicom + a real Torch denoiser (I can give you a 1-file version) Switch to watchdog library for true event-driven watching (no polling) Add a simple FastAPI endpoint to upload files Auto-generate PDF reports with the processed MRI + metadata Just tell me which direction you want and I’ll ship the next version instantly. 显示更多 自己去问 Grok 1

f_min) / (f_max - f_min) flat_clean = np.power(normalized, GAMMA) * (f_max - f_min) + f_min 4x4 patch tokenization → reconstruction patches = flat_clean.reshape(-1, 16) tokens = np.mean(patches, axis=1) reconstructed = np.repeat(tokens, 16)[:flat_clean.size] Noise metric noise_pct = (spikes.sum() / flat.size) * 100 Timestamped output — no silent overwrites ts = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%f") out_path = f"mri_processed_{ts}.npy" np.save(out_path, reconstructed.reshape(original_shape)) log.info("Saved -> %s", out_path) return f"MRI processed — shape {original_shape}, noise {noise_pct:.2f}%, saved {out_path}" ── File Router ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── HANDLERS = { ‘.txt’: lambda p: save_text(Path(p).read_text(), ‘notes.txt’), ‘.wav’: lambda p: save_text(speech_to_text(p), ‘audio_log.txt’), ‘.dcm’: lambda p: save_text(dicom_to_text(p), ‘scan_meta.txt’), ‘.npy’: lambda p: save_text(process_mri_slice(p),‘mri_processed.txt’), } def process_file(path: Path) -> None: handler = HANDLERS.get(path.suffix.lower()) if handler: handler(str(path)) log.info(“OK %s”, path.name) else: save_text(f”Unknown: {path.name}”, ‘unknown_log.txt’) log.warning(“SKIP (unknown type) %s”, path.name) ── Watchdog Loop ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT = 30 # seconds — raise alarm if a file takes longer POLL_INTERVAL = 2 # seconds between empty-queue checks MAX_ERRORS = 5 # consecutive errors before hard stop def run_pipeline() -> None: log.info(“REX pipeline started — watching %s”, INPUT_DIR) consecutive_errors = 0 while True: files = sorted(INPUT_DIR.iterdir()) if not files: log.debug("Queue empty — sleeping %ss", POLL_INTERVAL) time.sleep(POLL_INTERVAL) continue for path in files: if not path.is_file(): continue t0 = time.monotonic() try: process_file(path) elapsed = time.monotonic() - t0 if elapsed > WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT: log.error("WATCHDOG: %s took %.1fs (limit %ss)", path.name, elapsed, WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT) else: log.info(" %.2fs", elapsed) path.unlink() # clean up on success consecutive_errors = 0 except Exception as exc: consecutive_errors += 1 log.error("FAIL [%d/%d] %s — %s", consecutive_errors, MAX_ERRORS, path.name, exc) quarantine = INPUT_DIR / "quarantine" quarantine.mkdir(exist_ok=True) path.rename(quarantine / path.name) if consecutive_errors >= MAX_ERRORS: log.critical("MAX ERRORS reached — shutting down.") return log.info("Cycle done — waiting for next batch") if name == “main”: run_pipeline() 由 Grok 回答 Fully fixed & improved REX-Pipeline (v2 with your new gamma + timestamped output) All curly/smart quotes, markdown fences, and name typos are gone. I kept every feature you added (GAMMA=0.85, dynamic shape, timestamped .npy, inline logging) and made a few tiny robustness upgrades: encoding="utf-8" everywhere Processed files now saved in ./processed/ (cleaner than dumping in cwd) Minor style & safety tweaks (no silent overwrites, better logging) import time import logging import numpy as np from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime logging.basicConfig( level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s [%(levelname)s] %(message)s' ) log = logging.getLogger("REX-Pipeline") INPUT_DIR = Path("input_dir") INPUT_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True) PROCESSED_DIR = Path("processed") PROCESSED_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True) ── Stubs (swap with real implementations) ────────────────────────────────── def speech_to_text(wav_path: str) -> str: return "Heartbeat: 72 bpm, steady" def dicom_to_text(dcm_path: str) -> str: return "Patient ID: 12345, Slice: 17, Contrast: yes" def save_text(content: str, filename: str) -> None: with open(filename, "a", encoding="utf-8") as f: f.write(content + "\n") ── MRI Processing ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── GAMMA = 0.85 # str: img = np.load(img_path) original_shape = img.shape flat = img.flatten().astype(np.float32) Delta-based salt-and-pepper spike detection delta = np.abs(np.diff(flat, prepend=flat[0])) spike_threshold = delta.mean() + 3 * delta.std() spikes = delta > spike_threshold Repair: replace spikes with local neighbor mean flat_clean = flat.copy() spike_indices = np.where(spikes)[0] for idx in spike_indices: neighbors = flat[max(0, idx - 2):idx] flat_clean[idx] = neighbors.mean() if len(neighbors) else flat[idx] Gamma contrast (soft & diagnostic-range safe) f_min, f_max = flat_clean.min(), flat_clean.max() if f_max > f_min: normalized = (flat_clean - f_min) / (f_max - f_min) flat_clean = np.power(normalized, GAMMA) * (f_max - f_min) + f_min 4×4 patch tokenization → reconstruction patches = flat_clean.reshape(-1, 16) tokens = np.mean(patches, axis=1) reconstructed = np.repeat(tokens, 16)[:flat_clean.size] Noise metric noise_pct = (spikes.sum() / flat.size) * 100 Timestamped output in dedicated folder ts = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%f") out_path = PROCESSED_DIR / f"mri_processed_{ts}.npy" np.save(out_path, reconstructed.reshape(original_shape)) log.info("Saved -> %s", out_path) return f"MRI processed — shape {original_shape}, noise {noise_pct:.2f}%, saved {out_path.name}" ── File Router ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── HANDLERS = { ".txt": lambda p: save_text(Path(p).read_text(encoding="utf-8"), "notes.txt"), ".wav": lambda p: save_text(speech_to_text(p), "audio_log.txt"), ".dcm": lambda p: save_text(dicom_to_text(p), "scan_meta.txt"), ".npy": lambda p: save_text(process_mri_slice(p), "mri_processed.txt"), } def process_file(path: Path) -> None: handler = HANDLERS.get(path.suffix.lower()) if handler: handler(str(path)) log.info("OK %s", path.name) else: save_text(f"Unknown: {path.name}", "unknown_log.txt") log.warning("SKIP (unknown type) %s", path.name) ── Watchdog Loop ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT = 30 # seconds POLL_INTERVAL = 2 # seconds MAX_ERRORS = 5 def run_pipeline() -> None: log.info("REX pipeline started — watching %s", INPUT_DIR) consecutive_errors = 0 while True: files = sorted(INPUT_DIR.iterdir()) if not files: log.debug("Queue empty — sleeping %ss", POLL_INTERVAL) time.sleep(POLL_INTERVAL) continue for path in files: if not path.is_file(): continue t0 = time.monotonic() try: process_file(path) elapsed = time.monotonic() - t0 if elapsed > WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT: log.error("WATCHDOG: %s took %.1fs (limit %ss)", path.name, elapsed, WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT) else: log.info(" %.2fs", elapsed) path.unlink() # success → delete consecutive_errors = 0 except Exception as exc: consecutive_errors += 1 log.error("FAIL [%d/%d] %s — %s", consecutive_errors, MAX_ERRORS, path.name, exc) quarantine = INPUT_DIR / "quarantine" quarantine.mkdir(exist_ok=True) path.rename(quarantine / path.name) if consecutive_errors >= MAX_ERRORS: log.critical("MAX ERRORS reached — shutting down.") return log.info("Cycle done — waiting for next batch") if name == "main": run_pipeline() Test it mkdir input_dir processed Drop any .npy file into input_dir python rex_pipeline.py You’ll see a nicely named file appear in ./processed/ and a clean log entry. Next-level ideas (pick any): Replace stubs with Whisper + pydicom + a real Torch denoiser (I can give you a 1-file version) Switch to watchdog library for true event-driven watching (no polling) Add a simple FastAPI endpoint to upload files Auto-generate PDF reports with the processed MRI + metadata Just tell me which direction you want and I’ll ship the next version instantly. 显示更多 自己去问 Grok 1

$CRWV Q4 losses widen despite AI demand surge.
Revenue backlog 4x'd, but interest expenses spiked.
Technicals under pressure. Risk management paramount for $NVDA exposure.
WAGMI? Manage the downside first.

技术面承压。风险管理对于 NVDA 风险至关重要。

posts.name: Finance LOL
posts.text:
Finance LOL
@kava_invst
·
41秒
$NVDA pullback today is peak market behavior.
Step 1. Hype it for a week.
Step 2. Read the earnings.
Step 3. Panic anyway.
Down about 5.5% like the GPU forgot to say please.
Apparently “good” is only good if it is “perfect plus magic.
#NVDA #AI #Stocks
13
posts.zh:
金融哈哈
@kava_invst
·
41秒
今天 NVDA 的回调是市场行为的高峰。
第 1 步：炒作一周。
步骤 2. 阅读收益。
第三步：无论如何都要恐慌。
下降了大约 5.5%，就像 GPU 忘记说拜托一样。
显然，只有“完美加魔法”才是“好”。
#NVDA #AI #Stocks
13

Les marchés tech plombent les indices après un retournement sur $NVDA.
Une forte vente dans le secteur a entraîné le $SPX et le $IXIC à la baisse, l'optimisme initial sur les résultats s'étant transformé en prise de bénéfices.

posts.name: 미국주식 놀이터 : 뉴스부터 뻘글까지
posts.text:
미국주식 놀이터 : 뉴스부터 뻘글까지
USAnt 미국개미
@USAnt_IDEA
·
管理员
·
1分钟
 구글이 드디어 칼을 빼들고 AI 하드웨어 생태계의 판을 뒤엎겠다는 거대한 선전포고다. 
구글 $GOOGL 이 메타 $META 라는 거물에게 수십억 달러 규모의 TPU를 공급하고 렌탈 사업까지 확장한다는 건, 
그동안 엔비디아 $NVDA 혼자 다 해먹던 폭리의 시대가 끝을 보이고 있다는 뜻이다. 
똑똑한
显示更多
引用
Shay Boloor
@StockSavvyShay
·
4分钟
$GOOGL struck a multibillion-dollar deal to supply $META with its TPUs for AI model development with potential direct chip purchases as soon as next year.
Zuckerberg is now a customer of Google, $AMD & $NVDA simultaneously.
显示更多
1
35
posts.zh:
美国股票游乐场：从新闻到脏文章
美国蚂蚁
@USant_IDEA
·
管理员
·
1 份
 这是谷歌最终拔出剑、颠覆AI硬件生态的一次巨大宣战。 
谷歌 $GOOGL 向名为 $META 的巨头供应价值数十亿美元的 TPU，并扩大其租赁业务。 
这意味着仅靠NVIDIA$NVDA暴利的时代即将结束。 
聪明的
更多像我这样的人
供使用
谢伊·博洛尔
@StockSavvyShay
·
4分钟
$GOOGL 达成了一项价值数十亿美元的协议，向 $META 提供用于 AI 模型开发的 TPU，并可能最早在明年直接购买芯片。
扎克伯格现在同时是 Google、$AMD 和 $NVDA 的客户。
更多像我这样的人
1
35
